intro: Acianthera barthelemyi, commonly known as the Barthelemy's acianthera, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining substrates for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
